title: 100 Classic Girl Names
description: It's safe to say that we love traditional baby names (aka classic names or old-fashioned names). We named both of our kids after our grandparents – one on J’s side and one on mine. I recently heard names like that for baby girls being called "old lady names." Not sure how I feel about that - but a timeworn and classic name just feels like it's lovely and enduring. A friend of mine recently had a baby girl and it was fun to talk about all the names they were considering for her. And since I already shared a list of 100 classic boy names, I also loved compiling this list of my favorite classic old-fashioned baby girl names. Continue reading 100 Classic Girl Names at Young House Love.
author: Sherry Petersik
excerpt: Old-fashioned names are always on trend for baby girls, so here are more than 100 classic girl names, including the top 10 names for 2024.
text: It’s safe to say that we love traditional baby names (aka classic names or old-fashioned names). We named both of our kids after our grandparents – one on J’s side and one on mine. I recently heard names like that for baby girls being called “old lady names.” Not sure how I feel about that – but a timeworn and classic name just feels like it’s lovely and enduring. A friend of mine recently had a baby girl and it was fun to talk about all the names they were considering for her. And since I already shared a list of 100 classic boy names, I also loved compiling this list of my favorite classic old-fashioned baby girl names. One interesting thing I learned when I was writing this post is that many of the top ten most popular names for girls in the USA in 2024 could definitely be considered classic. And wildly enough, they all end in A except for two! #1: Olivia #2: Emma #3: Charlotte #4: Amelia #5: Sophia #6: Mia #7: Isabella #8: Eva #9: Evelyn #10: Luna But beyond that short list of the most popular baby girl names you see above, there are so many other classic and traditional names for baby girls. So here’s my big ol’ list of over 100 traditional / old-fashioned girl names: Abigail Ada Adeline Agnes Alice Amelia Anna Annmarie Audrey Aurora Astrid Ava Bea Billie Catherine Camila Camille Caroline Cecilia Celine Celeste Charlotte (Charlie) Clara Claire Cora Cordelia Daisy Daphne Delilah Delphine Dorothy (Dot) Eden Edith Effie Eleanor (Nora) Elena Elizabeth (Libby) Ella Elisa Eliza Eloise Emilia Emma Estelle Esther Etta Eva Evangeline Eve Evelyn Evie Florence Georgia Genevieve Grace / Gracie Hannah Hattie Harper Hazel Isabella Isabelle Iris Ivy Jane Jillian (Jill) Josephine Josie Julia Juliana Juliette June Kay Lena Lillian Liliana Lila Lily Lola Lucille Lydia Mabel Maeve Maisy Mallory Margot Mary Maya Melody Mia Millie Naomi Natalie Nellie Ophelia Olivia Olive Penelope Pia Piper Quinn Rosalie Rose Rosemary Ruby Sadie Sarah Scarlet Sloane Stella Sophia Sutton Theodora Valerie Vera Veronica Victoria Violet Vivian / Vivienne Willow So there you go. Over a hundred classic girl names that feel timeless and lovely. I really do adore them all. And as always I’ll remind you that I’m ready and willing to name your baby. Gimme a call ;) More posts from Young House Love
html:
It’s safe to say that we love traditional baby names (aka classic names or old-fashioned names). We named both of our kids after our grandparents – one on J’s side and one on mine. I recently heard names like that for baby girls being called “old lady names.” Not sure how I feel about that – but a timeworn and classic name just feels like it’s lovely and enduring. A friend of mine recently had a baby girl and it was fun to talk about all the names they were considering for her. And since I already shared a list of 100 classic boy names, I also loved compiling this list of my favorite classic old-fashioned baby girl names.

One interesting thing I learned when I was writing this post is that many of the top ten most popular names for girls in the USA in 2024 could definitely be considered classic. And wildly enough, they all end in A except for two!

  • #1: Olivia
  • #2: Emma
  • #3: Charlotte
  • #4: Amelia
  • #5: Sophia
  • #6: Mia
  • #7: Isabella
  • #8: Eva
  • #9: Evelyn
  • #10: Luna

But beyond that short list of the most popular baby girl names you see above, there are so many other classic and traditional names for baby girls. So here’s my big ol’ list of over 100 traditional / old-fashioned girl names:

  • Abigail
  • Ada
  • Adeline
  • Agnes
  • Alice
  • Amelia
  • Anna
  • Annmarie
  • Audrey
  • Aurora
  • Astrid
  • Ava
  • Bea
  • Billie
  • Catherine
  • Camila
  • Camille
  • Caroline
  • Cecilia
  • Celine
  • Celeste
  • Charlotte (Charlie)
  • Clara
  • Claire
  • Cora
  • Cordelia

  • Delphine

  • Julia
  • Juliana
  • Juliette
  • June
  • Kay
  • Lena
  • Lillian
  • Liliana
  • Lila
  • Lily
  • Lola
  • Lucille
  • Lydia
  • Mabel
  • Maeve
  • Maisy
  • Mallory

  • Mary
  • Maya
  • Melody
  • Mia
  • Millie
  • Naomi
  • Natalie
  • Nellie
  • Ophelia
  • Olivia
  • Olive
  • Penelope
  • Pia
  • Piper
  • Quinn
  • Rosalie
  • Rose
  • Rosemary
  • Ruby
  • Sadie
  • Sarah
  • Scarlet
  • Sloane
  • Stella
  • Sophia
  • Sutton
  • Theodora
  • Valerie
  • Vera
  • Veronica
  • Victoria
  • Violet
  • Vivian / Vivienne
  • Willow

So there you go. Over a hundred classic girl names that feel timeless and lovely. I really do adore them all. And as always I’ll remind you that I’m ready and willing to name your baby. Gimme a call ;)
